EDUCATIONAL TELEVISION STATIONS
A division of
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCA TIONAL BROADCASTERS
PHONE: 667-6000 • 1346 CONNECTICUT AVENUE • WASHINGTON, D.C. 20036
Office of the Executive Director February 17, 1969
MEMORANDUM
To: Executive Staff
cc: Holt Riddleberger
From: Chalmers H. Marquis
In our interconnection study last week we did discuss radio,
and the NAEB Board resolution in support thereof. I appreci¬
ate getting the copy of Fellows1 handwritten motion on behalf
of the Executive Board of NAEB noting that radio be included
henceforth in any negotiations. I hereby ask that that motion
be communicated officially by President Harley to the Ford
Foundation, the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, NET
and any others we may think relevant (FCC? , AT&T? ).
In Thursday’s interconnection meeting, radio received
substantial support from all, however, was not given
much time in the total discussions. We have not forgotten,
but it does need this kind of support at all times.
CHM/bb
